Detailed Description

Uart Instance configuration parameters A pointer to such a structure is used when driver is instantiated.

struct Uart_Params

Baudrate of Operation Refer Uart_BaudRate for valid values

Fifo mode of Operation

Hwi number used for uart isr

Bool Uart_Params::loopbackEnabled

LoopBack Mode flag

Int32 Uart_Params::opMode

Driver operational mode Refer Uart_OpMode for valid values

Int32 Uart_Params::parity

Parity of Operation Refer Uart_Parity for valid values

Int32 Uart_Params::pllDomain

Pll domain where the device is configured. Refer Uart_pllDomain for valid values

UInt32 Uart_Params::polledModeTimeout

Timeout used in polled mode. The timeout is based on BIOS Timestamp_get32()/Timestamp_get64() tick period. A value of BSP_UART_TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER could be used to make the timeout as forever (infinite wait). Note that the timeout value includes the actual RX/TX time as well.

Int Uart_Params::prcmDevId

prcm device ID

Ptr Uart_Params::prcmHandle

prcmHandle * This option enables the user to specify the Handle to the PRCM module.

It is required to specify the handle to the prcm module to enable the UART module in the prcm.

Default value is NULL.

It is important to create the prcm module before creating the uart driver instance.

Bool Uart_Params::prcmPwrmEnable

PSC control enable disable

Int32 Uart_Params::rxThreshold

Rx FIFO trigger level Refer Uart_RxTrigLvl for valid values

Int32 Uart_Params::stopBits

Stopbits of Operation Refer Uart_NumStopBits for valid values

Int32 Uart_Params::txThreshold

Rx FIFO trigger level Refer Uart_TxTrigLvl for valid values
